Shared UI

Example Plugin GitHub Repository

Usage

This page serves as a showcase for the Shared UI library used internally for WPMU DEV plugins.

npm install @wpmudev/shared-ui

Depending on your plugin's setup, you can either include the whole production ready css and js files or explicitly import needed sass partials & individual js components into your plugins build (recommended).

Requirements

In order to avoid conflicts with other versions of this library, we are using a versioned body class in the format .sui-x-x-x where hyphens are replacing the periods of the current shared-ui package version. When using the shared-ui library in your plugin, make sure you are adding a body class with the same shared-ui version you are using.

add_filter( 'admin_body_class', 'admin_body_classes' );
function admin_body_classes( $classes ) {

	$classes .= 'sui-2-3-4';

	return $classes;

}

Page Heading

Page Headings contain the h1 and have the options of actions left and right.

Example Heading

<div class="sui-header">
	<h1 class="sui-header-title">Example Heading</h1>
	<div class="sui-actions-left">
		<label class="sui-toggle">
			<input type="checkbox">
			<span class="sui-toggle-slider"></span>
		</label>
	</div>
	<div class="sui-actions-right">
		<button class="sui-button sui-button-ghost"><i class="sui-icon-academy"></i> View Documentation</button>
	</div>
</div>

Boxes

Boxes are the primary visual containers. They should be used to hold related information.

  • Basic Box
  • Settings Box
  • Status Box
  • Search Box
  • Message Box
  • Documentation

Message Box

This normal message box usually contains: image, title and text.

This large message box usually contains: image, text and button(s).

Base Structure This white-box contains several box-elements depending on what you need. 
<div class="sui-box">

	...

</div>
Box Header This is an element for sui-box. 
<div class="sui-box-header">

	<!-- Box title with icon -->
	<h3 class="sui-box-title">
		<i class="sui-icon-hummingbird" aria-hidden="true"></i> Basic Box
	</h3>

	<!-- Elements aligned to left, next to title -->
	<div class="sui-actions-left">
		...
	</div>

	<!-- Elements aligned to right -->
	<div class="sui-actions-right">
		...
	</div>

</div>
Box Content This is an element for sui-box. 
<div class="sui-box-body">

	...

</div>
Box Settings This is an element for sui-box-body.

In case you need a flushed settings, add sui-flushed next to sui-box-settings-row class.

<div class="sui-box-settings-row">

	<div class="sui-box-settings-col-1">
		<span class="sui-settings-label">Settings Label</span>
		<span class="sui-description">Some description you want to add.</span>
	</div>

	<div class="sui-box-settings-col-2">
		...
	</div>

</div>
Box Status Commonly used on plugins that make use of builders.   NOTE: This is a lonely element inside sui-box. 
<div class="sui-box-status">

	<div class="sui-status">

		<div class="sui-status-module">Status <span class="sui-tag">Draft</span></div>

		<div class="sui-status-changes"><i class="sui-icon-update" aria-hidden="true"></i> Unsaved changes</div>

	</div>

	<div class="sui-actions">

		<button id="forminator-module-save" class="sui-button">
			<span class="sui-loading-text">
				<i class="sui-icon-save" aria-hidden="true"></i>
				<span class="button-text">Save Draft</span>
			</span>
			<i class="sui-icon-loader sui-loading" aria-hidden="true"></i>
		</button>

		<button id="forminator-module-publish" class="sui-button sui-button-blue">
			<span class="sui-loading-text">
				<i class="sui-icon-web-globe-world" aria-hidden="true"></i>
				<span class="button-text">Publish</span>
			</span>
			<i class="sui-icon-loader sui-loading" aria-hidden="true"></i>
		</button>

	</div>

</div>
Box Message Commonly used to show an "empty" or "call-to-action" message.

In case you need a box with large margins use sui-message-lg next to sui-message class.

<div class="sui-box sui-message">

	<img src="image.png"
		srcset="image.png 1x, image@2x.png 2x"
		class="sui-image"
		aria-hidden="true" />

	<div class="sui-message-content">
		<h2>... title ...</h2>
		<p>... content ...</p>
		<p><button class="sui-button">Button</button></p>
	</div>

	<div class="sui-box-settings-col-2">
		...
	</div>

</div>

Selectors Box

This element is commonly used on dialogs and always have a light-gray background to highlight its white-box items. The main purpose of it is allow users to select one or more options.

  • Default
  • Vertical
  • The Grid
  • Documentation
Simple By default the box selectors are aligned horizontal, based on its icon + text position, and text is always left aligned.
Complex There are some cases where you gonna need to include a description for the items.
Simple You can vertical align box selectors where its text will always be center aligned and icon will be placed on top of text.
Complex There are some cases where you gonna need to include a description for the items.
Auto-Width Columns Not matter how many elements are, they all will be placed in one row.
1 Column The elements will occupy the full-width of the row.
2 Columns The elements will have 50% width and will be placed a max of two elements per row.
3 Columns Elements will ocuppy a third of a row, allowing a max of 3 elements to be placed per row.
Base Structure 
<div class="sui-box-selectors">

	<ul>

		<li><label for="" class="sui-box-selector">
			<input type="radio"
				id="" />
			<span>Element text</span>
		</label></li>

		<li><label for="" class="sui-box-selector">
			<input type="radio"
				id="" />
			<span>Element text</span>
		</label></li>
	
	</ul>

</div>
Elements Structure

To get a vertical element, it's necessary to add sui-box-selector-vertical class next to sui-box-selector.

<!-- Single Choice (Radio)
	 When you need user to pick one option only -->
<li><label for="item-id" class="sui-box-selector">
	<input type="radio"
		name="item-radio-input"
		id="item-id"
		checked="checked" />
	<span><i class="sui-icon-info" aria-hidden="true"></i> Item Name</span>
	<span>Here comes some description for your item.
</label></li>

<!-- Multiple Choice (Checkbox)
	 When you allow user to select more than one option -->
<li><label for="item-id" class="sui-box-selector">
	<input type="checkbox"
		name="item-checkbox-input"
		id="item-id"
		checked="checked" />
	<span><i class="sui-icon-info" aria-hidden="true"></i> Item Name</span>
	<span>Here comes some description for your item.
</label></li>
Grid Variations 
<!-- Auto Width Columns -->
<div class="sui-box-selectors">
	<ul> ... </ul>
</div>

<!-- 1 Column Per Row -->
<div class="sui-box-selectors sui-box-selectors-col-6">
	<ul> ... </ul>
</div>

<!-- 2 Columns Per Row -->
<div class="sui-box-selectors sui-box-selectors-col-3">
	<ul> ... </ul>
</div>

<!-- 3 Columns Per Row -->
<div class="sui-box-selectors sui-box-selectors-col-2">
	<ul> ... </ul>
</div>

Buttons

Use any of the available button classes to quickly create a styled button. Buttons are almost always used inside of a .sui-box.

<!-- Standard button -->
<button type="button" class="sui-button">Default</button>

<!-- Provides extra visual weight and identifies the primary action in a set of buttons -->
<button type="button" class="sui-button sui-button-primary">Primary</button>

<!-- Indicates a successful or positive action -->
<button type="button" class="sui-button sui-button-green">Green</button>

<!-- Indicates caution should be taken with this action -->
<button type="button" class="sui-button sui-button-red">Red</button>

<!-- Contextual button for informational alert messages -->
<button type="button" class="sui-button sui-button-ghost">Ghost</button>

Sizes

Need a larger button? Add .sui-button-lg to increase size.

<button type="button" class="sui-button sui-button-lg">Large Button</button>
<button type="button" class="sui-button sui-button-primary sui-button-lg">Large Button</button>

Button Icons

Include the icon inside of the button or link. The sui-button-icon-right class should be added to the button when they are displayed on the right of the text to ensure the appropriate separation.

<button type="button" class="sui-button sui-button-ghost sui-button-lg"><i class="sui-icon-info" aria-hidden="true"></i>Large Ghost Button</button>
<button type="button" class="sui-button sui-button-ghost sui-button-lg sui-button-icon-right">Large Ghost Button<i class="sui-icon-info" aria-hidden="true"></i></button>
<button type="button" class="sui-button sui-button-green"><i class="sui-icon-info" aria-hidden="true"></i> Green</button>
<button type="button" class="sui-button sui-button-green sui-button-icon-right">Green Button<i class="sui-icon-info" aria-hidden="true"></i></button>
<button type="button" class="sui-button sui-button-icon"><i class="sui-icon-arrow-right sui-fw" aria-hidden="true"></i><span class="sui-screen-reader-text">More Text</span></button>
<button type="button" class="sui-button sui-button-icon sui-button-lg"><i class="sui-icon-arrow-right sui-fw" aria-hidden="true"><span class="sui-screen-reader-text">More Text</span></i></button>
<!-- Icon-only button for settings or show a dialog (modal) - Note doesn't use the sui-button class -->
<button type="button" class="sui-button-icon"><i class="sui-icon-widget-settings-config" aria-hidden="true"></i></button>

Code Snippets

Code snippets are to be used to display code to the user and allow them to copy to clipboard.

If you are using individual js components, code-snippet.js is required for copy to clipboard functionality.

We use the library clipboard.js to allow code snippet copied.

Any element with the class sui-code-snippet will be instantiated SUICodeSnippet and the instance is accessible using jQuery selector like $('selector').data('SUICodeSnippet'). 

<IfModule mod_rewrite.c>
RewriteEngine On
RewriteBase /
RewriteRule ^index\.php$ - [L]
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-f
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-d
RewriteRule . /index.php [L]
</IfModule>
<pre class="sui-code-snippet">
	...
</pre>

Without copy button:

<IfModule mod_rewrite.c>
RewriteEngine On
RewriteBase /
RewriteRule ^index\.php$ - [L]
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-f
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_FILENAME} !-d
RewriteRule . /index.php [L]
</IfModule>
<pre class="sui-code-snippet sui-no-copy">
	...
</pre>

Javascript Instantiation

// initiate all sui-code-snippet
SUI.suiCodeSnippet();

// initiate single sui-code-snippet
$('.my-selector').SUICodeSnippet();

JS API

// initiate with custom copy text
$('.my-selector').SUICodeSnippet({
	'copyText': 'Copy .htaccess', // button text
	'copiedText': '.htaccess copied', // tooltip text when copied
});

// get Clipboard.JS inistance
const clipboard = $('.my-selector').data('SUICodeSnippet').getClipboardJs();
clipboard.on('success', function(e){
	alert('Copied!');
});

// destroy instance
$('.my-selector').data('SUICodeSnippet').destroy();

Grid

The grid system should be used to layout boxes & forms. The grid requires a minimum of 2 components, the columns, and the row that wraps the columns.

For equally spaced columns that stay inline at all breakpoints, you can use the basic .sui-col:

.sui-col
.sui-col
<div class="sui-row">
	<div class="sui-col">
		...
	</div>
	<div class="sui-col">
		...
	</div>
</div>

For more control over column behavior for different breakpoints, there is a 12 column grid similar to Bootstrap 3 naming conventions & behavior but powered by flexbox instead of floats:

.sui-col-md-3
.sui-col-md-6
.sui-col-md-3
<div class="sui-row">
	<div class="sui-col-md-3">
		...
	</div>
	<div class="sui-col-md-6">
		...
	</div>
	<div class="sui-col-md-3">
		...
	</div>
</div>

Examples:

.sui-col-lg-3
.sui-col-lg-3
.sui-col-lg-3
.sui-col-lg-3
.sui-col-sm-9
.sui-col-sm-3
.sui-col-lg-4
.sui-col-lg-4 .sui-col-lg-offset-4
.sui-col-sm-8 .sui-col-sm-offset-4
.sui-col-sm-7 .sui-col-sm-offset-5

You can reverse the order of the columns by adding the class .sui-reverse to the .sui-row element.

Original:

1
2
3
<div class="sui-row">
	<div class="sui-col">
		1
	</div>
	<div class="sui-col">
		2
	</div>
	<div class="sui-col">
		3
	</div>
</div>

Reversed:

1
2
3
<div class="sui-row sui-reverse">
	<div class="sui-col">
		1
	</div>
	<div class="sui-col">
		2
	</div>
	<div class="sui-col">
		3
	</div>
</div>

Use a single or combination of the available classes for toggling content across viewport breakpoints.

Extra small devices Phones (<480px) Small devices Tablets (≥480px) Medium devices Desktops (≥800px) Large devices Desktops (≥1200px)
.sui-hidden-xs Hidden Visible Visible Visible
.sui-hidden-sm Visible Hidden Visible Visible
.sui-hidden-md Visible Visible Hidden Visible
.sui-hidden-lg Visible Visible Visible Hidden

Examples:

.sui-hidden-md .sui-hidden-sm .sui-hidden-xs
.sui-hidden-md
.sui-hidden-lg

Progress Bars

Progress bars can be dynamically moved by changing the width of .sui-progress-bar span with js.

0%
Can't close progress bar... 
<div class="sui-progress-block">
	<div class="sui-progress">
		<div class="sui-progress-text sui-icon-loader sui-loading">
			<span>0%</span>
		</div>
		<div class="sui-progress-bar">
			<span style="width: 0"></span>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>
<div class="sui-progress-state">
	<span class="sui-progress-state-text">Can't close progress bar...</span>
</div>
20%
Can close progress bar... 
<div class="sui-progress-block sui-progress-can-close">
	<div class="sui-progress">
		<div class="sui-progress-text sui-icon-loader sui-loading">
			<span>20%</span>
		</div>
		<div class="sui-progress-bar">
			<span style="width: 20%"></span>
		</div>
	</div>
	<button class="sui-progress-close sui-tooltip" type="button" data-tooltip="Cancel Test">
		<i class="sui-icon-close"></i>
	</button>
</div>

<div class="sui-progress-state">
	<span class="sui-progress-state-text">Can close progress bar...</span>
</div>

Link To

Choose content you want to convert to links.

Insert Links

Specify what post types to insert links into.

<div class="sui-box">
	<div class="sui-box-body">
		<div class="sui-row">
			<div class="sui-col-sm-6">
				<div class="sui-field-list">
					<div class="sui-field-list-header">
						<h3 class="sui-field-list-title">Link To</h3>
						<p class="sui-description">Choose content you want to convert to links.</p>
					</div>
					<div class="sui-field-list-body">
						<div class="sui-field-list-item">
							<label class="sui-field-list-item-label" for="demo-table-2-toggle-1">
								Posts
							</label>
							<label class="sui-toggle">
								<input type="checkbox" id="demo-table-2-toggle-1">
								<span class="sui-toggle-slider"></span>
							</label>
						</div>
						<div class="sui-field-list-item">
							<label class="sui-field-list-item-label" for="demo-table-2-toggle-2">
								Pages
							</label>
							<label class="sui-toggle">
								<input type="checkbox" id="demo-table-2-toggle-2">
								<span class="sui-toggle-slider"></span>
							</label>
						</div>
						<div class="sui-field-list-item">
							<label class="sui-field-list-item-label" for="demo-table-2-toggle-3">
								Categories
							</label>
							<label class="sui-toggle">
								<input type="checkbox" id="demo-table-2-toggle-3">
								<span class="sui-toggle-slider"></span>
							</label>
						</div>
						<div class="sui-field-list-item">
							<label class="sui-field-list-item-label" for="demo-table-2-toggle-4">
								Tags
							</label>
							<label class="sui-toggle">
								<input type="checkbox" id="demo-table-2-toggle-4">
								<span class="sui-toggle-slider"></span>
							</label>
						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
			</div>
			<div class="sui-col-sm-6">
				<div class="sui-field-list">
					<div class="sui-field-list-header">
						<h3 class="sui-field-list-title">Insert Links</h3>
						<p class="sui-description">Specify what post types to insert links into.</p>
					</div>
					<div class="sui-field-list-body">
						<div class="sui-field-list-item">
							<label class="sui-field-list-item-label" for="demo-table-2-toggle-5">
								Posts
							</label>
							<label class="sui-toggle">
								<input type="checkbox" id="demo-table-2-toggle-5">
								<span class="sui-toggle-slider"></span>
							</label>
						</div>
						<div class="sui-field-list-item">
							<label class="sui-field-list-item-label" for="demo-table-2-toggle-6">
								Pages
							</label>
							<label class="sui-toggle">
								<input type="checkbox" id="demo-table-2-toggle-6">
								<span class="sui-toggle-slider"></span>
							</label>
						</div>
						<div class="sui-field-list-item">
							<label class="sui-field-list-item-label" for="demo-table-2-toggle-7">
								Comments
							</label>
							<label class="sui-toggle">
								<input type="checkbox" id="demo-table-2-toggle-8">
								<span class="sui-toggle-slider"></span>
							</label>
						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

Documentation

If you want to perform some actions, like open a menu or adding a link, inside accordion items header remember to add sui-accordion-item-action to the element, that way when user clicks on the item it won't open/close the accordion but instead perform the action you want to like openning a dropdown menu with more options.

Flexbox Accordions 
<div class="sui-accordion">

	<div class="sui-accordion-header">
		<div>Recommendation</div>
		<div>Score / 100</div>
		<div>Type</div>
	</div>

	<div class="sui-accordion-item">

		<div class="sui-accordion-item-header">
			<div class="sui-accordion-item-title"><i aria-hidden="true" class="sui-icon-warning-alert sui-error"></i> Item</div>
			<div><div class="sui-circle-score sui-grade-f" data-score="8"></div></div>
			<div>More info on something <button class="sui-button-icon sui-accordion-open-indicator" aria-label="Open item"><i class="sui-icon-chevron-down" aria-hidden="true"></i></button></div>
		</div>

		<div class="sui-accordion-item-body">
			<div class="sui-box">
				<div class="sui-box-body">
					<p>Item content – Hello!</p>
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>

</div>
Table Accordions 
<table class="sui-table sui-accordion">

	<thead>
		<tr>
			<th>Recommendation</th>
			<th>Score / 100</th>
			<th>Type</th>
		</tr>
	</thead>

	<tbody>

		<tr class="sui-accordion-item">
			<td class="sui-table-item-title"><i aria-hidden="true" class="sui-icon-warning-alert sui-error"></i> Item</td>
			<td><div class="sui-circle-score sui-grade-f" data-score="6"></div></td>
			<td>More info on something. <button class="sui-button-icon sui-accordion-open-indicator" aria-label="Expand"><i class="sui-icon-chevron-down" aria-hidden="true"></i></button></td>
		</tr>

		<tr class="sui-accordion-item-content">
			<td colspan="3">
				<div class="sui-box">
					<div class="sui-box-body">
						<p>Item content – Hello!</p>
					</div>
				</div>
			</td>
		</tr>

	</tbody>

</table>
Accordion Blocks 
<div class="sui-accordion sui-accordion-block">

	<div class="sui-accordion-item">

		<!-- Item header -->
		<div class="sui-accordion-item-header">

			<div class="sui-accordion-item-title sui-trim-title">Title <span class="sui-tag sui-tag-blue">Published</span></div>

			<div class="sui-accordion-item-date"><strong>Last Submission</strong> March 11, 2017 @ 10:18am</div>

			<div class="sui-accordion-col-auto">
				<button class="sui-button sui-button-ghost sui-accordion-item-action"><i class="sui-icon-pencil" aria-hidden="true"></i> Edit</button>
				<div class="sui-dropdown sui-accordion-item-action">
					<a href="#" class="sui-dropdown-anchor sui-icon-widget-settings-config" aria-label="Open Item Settings"></a>
					<ul>
						<li><a href=""><i class="sui-icon-eye" aria-hidden="true"></i> Preview</a></li>
						<li><a href=""><i class="sui-icon-community-people" aria-hidden="true"></i> View</a></li>
						<li><a href=""><i class="sui-icon-page-multiple" aria-hidden="true"></i> Duplicate</a></li>
						<li><a href=""><i class="sui-icon-cloud-migration" aria-hidden="true"></i> Export</a></li>
						<li><a href=""><i class="sui-icon-trash" aria-hidden="true"></i> Delete</a></li>
					</ul>
				</div>
				<button class="sui-button-icon sui-accordion-open-indicator" aria-label="Open Item"><i class="sui-icon-chevron-down" aria-hidden="true"></i></button>
			</div>

		</div>

		<!-- Item content -->
		<div class="sui-accordion-item-body">Your content goes here</div>

	</div>

</div>
Disabled Item Disable the row and prevent from opening.

Disable a flexbox accordion item:

<div class="sui-accordion-item"> ... </div>
<div class="sui-accordion-item"> ... </div>
<div class="sui-accordion-item sui-accordion-item--disabled"> ... </div>

Disable a table accordion item:

<tbody>
	<tr class="sui-accordion-item sui-accordion-item--disabled"> ... </tr>
	<tr class="sui-accordion-item-content"> ... </tr>
</tbody>

Scores

Animated gauges for scoring. Circles animate on page load.

If you are using individual js components, scores.js is required.

<div class="sui-circle-score sui-grade-f" data-score="10"></div>
<div class="sui-circle-score sui-grade-c" data-score="55"></div>
<div class="sui-circle-score sui-grade-a" data-score="95"></div>
<div class="sui-circle-score sui-circle-score-lg sui-grade-a" data-score="90"></div>

Dropdowns

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet.

  • Samples
  • Documentation

Samples

Default Menu by default is right-aligned with the button.
  • External link
  • Link with icon
Left Menu Menu will be left-aligned with the button.

  • Link with icon
Center Menu Menu will be center-aligned with the button.

Documentation

If you are using SUI 2.3.2 or older version, you need to update the dropdown button markup when you upgrate to SUI 2.3.3.

If you are using individual js components, dropdowns.js is required.

Element Markup This is the correct markup to use for dropdown elements. 
<div class="sui-dropdown">
	<button class="sui-button-icon sui-dropdown-anchor" aria-label="Dropdown">
		<i class="sui-icon-widget-settings-config" aria-hidden="true"></i>
	</button>
	<ul>
		<li><button>CTA Button</button></li>
		<li><a href="http://external-link.com/" target="_blank">External link</a></li>
		<li><button><i class="sui-icon-trash" aria-hidden="true"></i> Button with icon</button></li>
	</ul>
</div>
Menu Variations There are some projects where the menu should display in different places.
In case you need the menu aligns to the left, you can make use of sui-dropdown-right class. For example: 
<div class="sui-dropdown sui-dropdown-right">
	<!-- The rest of the element goes here -->
</div>
In case you need the menu aligns to the middle, you can make use of sui-dropdown-center class. For example: 
<div class="sui-dropdown sui-dropdown-center">
	<!-- The rest of the element goes here -->
</div>

Forms

Form layouts, inputs, input groups, and error styles.

If you are using individual js components, password.js is required for show/hide password functionality.

Default
Input Error
This is an error message.
Input Sizes Some projects will require constrained input fields, for those cases you can use size variation.
Usually used when the expected input is 1 to 4 chars.
This is the standard size of an input when 100% is to wide.

Radio

Used for inline field selection when only a few options are present. If that are enough options that it can take up a lot of space it may make more sense to use multiselect or select.

Inline A standard radio layout, placed next to eachoter.
Stacked A standard radio layout, stacked on top of one another.
Small
Radio Image

Used for inline field selection when only a few options are present. If that are enough options that it can take up a lot of space it may make more sense to use multiselect or select.

Inline A standard checkbox layout, placed next to eachoter.
Stacked A standard checkbox layout, stacked on top of one another.

To be used when the user only needs to upload a general file, not image.

Default For use as a general file uploader that doesn’t require an image previewer.
Selected When the user has selected a file.
example-file.pdf
The user can click the whole block to change the file, or click the X to remove file.
Upload error When there is an issue uploading the file, or it’s the wrong file type.

Whoops, only .pdf and .doc filetypes are allowed.

Multi - Default When the user is allowed to upload multiple files.
Multi - Selected When files have been chosen we keep the button.
Note: The button copy can be changed to be more contextual.
example-file.pdf

filename.jpg

Input 
<!-- Default -->
<input type="text"
	class="sui-form-control" />

<!-- SIZE: Small -->
<input type="text"
	class="sui-form-control sui-input-sm" />

<!-- SIZE: Medium -->
<input type="text"
	class="sui-form-control sui-input-md" />

<!-- Input Error -->
<div class="sui-form-field sui-form-field-error">
	<label class="sui-label">Label</label>
	<input type="text"
		class="sui-form-control" />
	<span class="sui-error-message">This field has an error.</span>
</div>
Radio

This element allows two variations: stacked and small.

For stacked radios you need to use <label class="sui-radio sui-radio-stacked">. For small radios try with <label class="sui-radio sui-radio-sm">

<label for="demo-radio--option-one" class="sui-radio">
	<input type="radio"
		name="demo-radio--options"
		id="demo-radio--option-one" />
	<span aria-hidden="true"></span>
	<span>Radio label</span>
</label>
Checkbox

This element allows two variations: stacked and small.

For stacked checkboxes you need to use <label class="sui-checkbox sui-checkbox-stacked">. For small checkboxes try with <label class="sui-checkbox sui-checkbox-sm">

<label for="demo-checkbox--option-one" class="sui-checkbox">
	<input type="checkbox"
		id="demo-checkbox--option-one" />
	<span aria-hidden="true"></span>
	<span>Checkbox label</span>
</label>

	</button>

	</div>

		</div>

jQuery UI – Calendar

The Shared UI supports styling of the jQuery UI datepicker but doesn't include the library so you will need to include that in your plugin yourself. To use the styles you will need to add the class sui-calendar to your datepicker element.

See code snippet below to see how it was done in this showcase.

$( '.sui-date .sui-form-control' ).datepicker({
		beforeShow: function( input, inst ) {
			$( '#ui-datepicker-div' ).addClass( 'sui-calendar' );
		},
		'dateFormat': 'd MM yy'
	});

Form Groups

When multiple inputs are stacked vertically, they should be wrapped in the .sui-form-field class to create vertical separation.

<div class="sui-box">
	<div class="sui-box-body">
		<div class="sui-form-field">
			<label for="demo-form-groups-text-1" class="sui-label">Input Label</label>
			<input type="text" id="demo-form-groups-text-1" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type text">
		</div>
		<div class="sui-form-field">
			<label for="demo-form-groups-text-2" class="sui-label">Input Label</label>
			<input type="text" id="demo-form-groups-text-2" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type text">
		</div>
		<div class="sui-form-field">
			<label for="demo-form-groups-text-3" class="sui-label">Input Label</label>
			<input type="text" id="demo-form-groups-text-3" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type text">
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

Form Layout

For multiple columns within a form, utilize the Shared UI grid system.

Input Sizes

Input fields have a default width of 100%.

To constrain the size of the input field you can add the following classes to either the sui-form-field or to the sui-form-control

sui-input-sm for a width of 80px, this is usually used when the expected input is 1 to 5 chars.

sui-input-md for a width of 240px, this is the standard size of an input when 100% is to wide.

You would use the sizing class in sui-form-field when there are other labels around the input that need to be constrained e.g. password input

This is a description about the field.

Example of using sui-input-sm in sui-form-control

<div class="sui-box">
	<div class="sui-box-body">
		<div class="sui-row">
			<div class="sui-col-sm-6">
				<div class="sui-form-field">
					<label for="demo-form-layout-text-1" class="sui-label">Input Label</label>
					<input type="text" id="demo-form-layout-text-1" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type text">
				</div>
			</div>
			<div class="sui-col-sm-6">
				<div class="sui-form-field">
					<label for="demo-form-layout-text-2" class="sui-label">Input Label</label>
					<input type="text" id="demo-form-layout-text-2" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type text">
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
		<div class="sui-row">
			<div class="sui-col-sm-4">
				<div class="sui-form-field">
					<label for="demo-form-layout-text-3" class="sui-label">Input Label</label>
					<input type="text" id="demo-form-layout-text-3" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type text">
				</div>
			</div>
			<div class="sui-col-sm-8">
				<div class="sui-form-field">
					<label for="demo-form-layout-text-4" class="sui-label">Input Label</label>
					<input type="text" id="demo-form-layout-text-4" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type text">
				</div>
			</div>
		</div>
	</div>
</div>

<!-- Input Sizes -->
<div class="sui-form-field sui-input-md">
	<label for="password1" class="sui-label">Password <a role="button" href="#" class="sui-label-link">Forgot Password</a></label>
	<div class="sui-password-group">
		<input type="password" id="password1" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type password" required>
		<button class="sui-password-toggle sui-tooltip" type="button" data-tooltip="View Password">
			<i aria-hidden="true" class="sui-icon-eye"></i>
		</button>
	</div>
	<span class="sui-description">This is a description about the field.</span>
</div>
<div class="sui-form-field">
	<label for="forms-number-3" class="sui-label">Input Label</label>
	<input type="number" id="forms-number-3" class="sui-form-control sui-input-sm" placeholder="input type number">
	<span class="sui-description">Tiny Number</span>
</div>

Inline Errors

These error classes should be used when validating forms. Add the class.sui-form-field-error to the form-field or the direct parent wrapper of the input.
Note that the error message should be directly adjacent to the input. This means that if the field also has a description, the error message should be placed in between.

This is an error message!
This is an error message! This is a description about the field. 
<div class="sui-box">
	<div class="sui-box-body">

		<!-- text input -->
		<div class="sui-form-field">
			<label for="demo-input-error-text-1" class="sui-label">Input Label</label>
			<input type="text" id="demo-input-error-text-1" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type text">
		</div>

		<!-- text input with error -->
		<div class="sui-form-field sui-form-field-error">
			<label for="demo-input-error-text-2" class="sui-label">Input Label</label>
			<input type="number" id="demo-input-error-text-2" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type text">
			<span class="sui-error-message">This is an error message!</span>
		</div>

		<!-- text input with description and error -->
		<div class="sui-form-field sui-form-field-error">
			<label for="demo-input-error-text-3" class="sui-label">Input Label</label>
			<input type="number" id="demo-input-error-text-3" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type text">
			<span class="sui-error-message">This is an error message!</span>
			<span class="sui-description">This is a description about the field.</span>
		</div>

	</div>
</div>

Summary

The summary is used to display a summary of the pages information.

Summary box variables has been updated on SUI 2.3.1. To load an image into summary box you need to use $summary-image: 'path-to-image';. For other variables like image size and position you can check _variables.scss file.

  • Small
  • Unbranded
  • Rebranded

Use sui-unbranded class when Hide WPMU DEV Branding settings are enabled but user didn't add any image or image is null.

Use sui-rebranded class when Hide WPMU DEV Branding settings are enabled and user added an image. Make sure to add the image url as an inline background image for sui-summary-image-space div.

Documentation

Variables Depending on the project and the image size you gonna use for the Summary element, you gonna have to overwrite some base variables.   NOTE: Remember to include these variables on top of your file to call them correctly during build.
This element is set to have min-height: 212px, making it the most used through projects. 
// Set summary image
//
// NOTE: If you don't enter this variable, the image won't show on the summary.
$summary-image: 'path-to-plugin/assets/images/your-image.png';

// ========================================
// Overwrite image size
$summary-image--width:  192px;
$summary-image--height: 182px;

// ========================================
// Overwrite image position
$summary-image--position-x: 30px; // Horizontal position (only)
$summary-image--position-y: bottom; // Vertical position (only)
This element is set to have min-height: 151px, used mostly on projects that require a small resume to display, like Forminator's forms listings page. 
// Set small summary image
//
// NOTE: If you don't enter this variable and $summary-image exists,
// this image will show instead small summary image, but if none of them
// exist the image won't show on the summary.
$summary-image-sm: 'path-to-plugin/assets/images/your-small-image.png';

// Overwrite image size
$summary-image-sm--width:  192px;
$summary-image-sm--height: 121px;

// ========================================
// Overwrite image position
$summary-image-sm--position-x: 30px; // Horizontal position (only)
$summary-image-sm--position-y: bottom; // Vertical position (only)
Markup There's one base markup for the summary element with just a slight change based on the box size.

If you need a small summary you can add next to sui-summary a new class called sui-summary-sm.

<div class="sui-box sui-summary">

	<div class="sui-summary-image-space" aria-hidden="true"></div>

	<div class="sui-summary-segment">

		<div class="sui-summary-details">

			<span class="sui-summary-large">97</span>
			<i aria-hidden="true" class="sui-icon-info sui-warning"></i>
			<span class="sui-summary-percent">/100</span>
			<span class="sui-summary-sub">Current performance score</span>

			<span class="sui-summary-detail">December 12, 2017 at 1:46 am</span>
			<span class="sui-summary-sub">Last test</span>

		</div>

	</div>

	<div class="sui-summary-segment">

		<ul class="sui-list">

			<li>
				<span class="sui-list-label">Previous score</span>
				<span class="sui-list-detail">76</span>
			</li>

			<li>
				<span class="sui-list-label">Improvement</span>
				<span class="sui-list-detail"><span class="sui-tag sui-tag-error">-1</span></span>
			</li>

			<li>
				<span class="sui-list-label">Recommendations</span>
				<span class="sui-list-detail">4</span>
			</li>

		</ul>

	</div>

</div>

If you are using individual js components, tabs.js is required.

Side Tabs

Side tabs are used more like a selector. They can used for yes/no, or more usually for choosing which option out of 2+ to choose from and then showing content for that choice.

Default Default tabs state, with no content - just a plain selector.

Top Notifications

The top notifications have a different styling and are fixed. They use the class .sui-notice-top or .sui-notice-floating in the parent class instead of .sui-notice. You will see an example of how the top notification looks when you refresh this page.

The default sui-notice-top notification will automatically hide after 3 seconds. If you prefer the user to hide the notification themselves you can add .sui-can-dismiss to the parent div and add a dismiss button to the notice shown in the code sample below.

If you don't want the notice dismissed at all you can add .sui-cant-dismiss to the parent div.

Below are examples of both the sui-notice-top and the sui-notice-floating (floating with button)

You can override the icon with the following code

p:first-of-type {
	@include icon(before, update)
}
// Top notice with button.
<div class="sui-notice-top sui-notice-success sui-can-dismiss">
	<p><strong>Notice success:</strong> Page caching is currently active.</p>
	<span class="sui-notice-dismiss">
		<a role="button" href="#" aria-label="Dismiss" class="sui-icon-check"></a>
	</span>
</div>
// Floating notice with button.
<div class="sui-notice-floating sui-notice-info">
	<p>You've made changes to your file structure</p>
	<div class="sui-notice-buttons">
		<button href="#" class="sui-button sui-button-blue"><i class="sui-icon-web-globe-world" aria-hidden="true"></i>Publish</button>
	</div>
</div>

Icons

All icons are prefixed with .sui-icon-.

Example: 
<i class="sui-icon-wpmudev-logo" aria-hidden="true"></i>

The following icons are available. Click icon to copy markup to clipboard.

Icon Sizes

The default size of an icon is the same as its parent element. For more specific sizes, you can choose from the following:

<!-- Small -->
<i class="sui-icon-wpmudev-logo sui-sm" aria-hidden="true"></i>

<!-- Medium -->
<i class="sui-icon-wpmudev-logo sui-md" aria-hidden="true"></i>

<!-- Large -->
<i class="sui-icon-wpmudev-logo sui-lg" aria-hidden="true"></i>

<!-- Extra Large -->
<i class="sui-icon-wpmudev-logo sui-xl" aria-hidden="true"></i>

Fixed Width Icons

Use .sui-fw to set icons at a fixed width. Great to use when different icon widths throw off alignment. Especially useful in things like nav lists & list groups.

  • Hummingbird
  • Code
  • Defender
<ul>
	<li><i class="sui-icon-hummingbird sui-fw" aria-hidden="true"></i> Hummingbird</li>
	<li><i class="sui-icon-code sui-fw" aria-hidden="true"></i> Code</li>
	<li><i class="sui-icon-defender sui-fw" aria-hidden="true"></i> Defender</li>
</ul>

Animated Icons

You can infinitely spin an icon by adding the .sui-loading class.

<i class="sui-icon-loader sui-loading" aria-hidden="true"></i>

Dialogs

If you are using individual js components, dialog.js and a11y-dialog.js are both required.

Dialogs are streamlined, but flexible, dialog prompts with the minimum required functionality.

We use the library A11y-Dialog to make sure they're accessible as possible.

Any dialogs with the class sui-dialog will be instantiated and stored in SUI.dialogs with their id. You will be able to call methods on these instances eg SUI.dialogs['my-accessible-dialog'].hide() will hide the corresponding dialog with the id my-accessible-dialog.

Javascript Instantiation

// Get the dialog element (with the accessor method you want)
const el = document.getElementById('my-accessible-dialog');

// Instantiate a new A11yDialog module
const dialog = new A11yDialog(el);

DOM API

The following button will open the dialog with the my-accessible-dialog id when interacted with. 

<button type="button" data-a11y-dialog-show="my-accessible-dialog">Open the dialog</button>

The following button will hide the dialog with the my-accessible-dialog id when interacted with. 

<button type="button" data-a11y-dialog-hide>Close the dialog</button>

JS API

Regarding the JS API, it simply consists on show() and hide() methods on the dialog instance.

// Show the dialog
dialog.show();

// Hide the dialog
dialog.hide();

The following code snippet is an example of the dialog code.

<div class="sui-dialog" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1" id="my-accessible-dialog">

	<div class="sui-dialog-overlay" data-a11y-dialog-hide></div>

	<div class="sui-dialog-content" aria-labelledby="dialogTitle" aria-describedby="dialogDescription" role="dialog">

		<div class="sui-box" role="document">

			<div class="sui-box-header">
				<h3 class="sui-box-title" id="dialogTitle">Dialog Title</h3>
				<div class="sui-actions-right">
					<button data-a11y-dialog-hide class="sui-dialog-close" aria-label="Close this dialog window"></button>
				</div>
			</div>

			<div class="sui-box-body">
				<p id="dialogDescription">Fill in the ridiculously small form below to receive our ridiculously cool newsletter!</p>
				<div class="sui-row">
					<div class="sui-col">
						<div class="sui-form-field">
							<label for="dialog-text-5" class="sui-label">Text</label>
							<input type="text" id="dialog-text-5" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type text">
						</div>
					</div>
					<div class="sui-col">
						<div class="sui-form-field">
							<label for="dialog-text-6" class="sui-label">Text</label>
							<input type="text" id="dialog-text-6" class="sui-form-control" placeholder="input type text">
						</div>
					</div>
				</div>
			</div>

			<div class="sui-box-footer">
				<div class="sui-flex-child-right">
					<button class="sui-button" data-a11y-dialog-hide="my-accessible-dialog">Cancel</button>
					<button class="sui-modal-close sui-button sui-button-blue">Add</button>
				</div>
			</div>

		</div>

	</div>

</div>

Documentation

Branded Footer This element is used on all plugins: pro and free versions. 
<div class="sui-footer">Made with <i class="sui-icon-heart"></i> by WPMU DEV</div>
Cross-Sell Banners This element is used on free plugins to promote our top products available on WordPress.
Markup 
<!-- Have in mind you can have a max of 3 banners in the footer -->

<div class="sui-cross-1">
	<span></span>
</div>
SCSS File 
// Cross-sell Banners
// In lowercase insert the name of the plugin you want to promote.

$cross-sell-1: 'smush';
$cross-sell-2: 'defender';
$cross-sell-3: 'smartcrawl';
